Articles.Content:
Rotors do have a tendency to fly off on their own after a while, but other than that, it works and is controllable (no spin icon on the SAS)

![ax2q6top8b15mya7g.jpg](https://www./convkey/dd16/ax2q6top8b15mya7g.jpg)

A sideways pointing jet engine at the back is used at low throttle to counteract the spin imparted from the rotors (and helpfully generates electricity in the process), and then SAS is strong enough to actually control the craft.
